text: When publishing Staging Content I noticed that the back button takes me to Website Pages which then I need to click to get to staging content then again select my staging domain...This could be so much quicker if it took you directly back to staging content on your selected staging domain

random but I’ve been wondering - why were advanced menus renamed in design manager 2 to simply Menu - while simple menu kept it’s name?

was “advanced” a scary word so people were avoiding it or something?
Yes, it was too ‘advanced’ for some people…

I’m not 100% positive, but I believe that the actual name of the module was ‘Menu’, and the label was ‘Advanced Menu’. For example, the HubL Tag has always been {% menu %} - <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules#menu>

I realize this is possibly difficult to do but would be a cool convenience feature.

If you have multiple HubSpot default modules of the same type selected, It would be super cool if you could set their options at the same time.

example: I’m building a footer for a site that has 6 vertical advanced menus. All will have the same appearancce the only difference will be the menu that is selected. So it would be cool if I could set them all to vertical, no fly outs etc
Couldn’t you do this by setting all your items on 1 module and then cloning/duplicating the module multiple times?
Copy and paste isn't a thing in the drag n drop
